Calixto of Balugo, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, is a farmer. He is 60 years old and married with six adult children. For a living, he manages his own farm, planting and harvesting corn for consumption and delivering a portion of the produce for sale in the market. He has been a farmer for 12 years. 

In 2008, he joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase fertilizer and finance the costs for land preparation. He hopes to produce more harvest this cropping in order to generate more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and finance the costs for land preparation.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with a responsibility of taking care of eight school-going children.

He practices farming, and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and expand his farming activities. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes affect his business, while his desire is to educate his children up to the University and venture into commercialized agriculture. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Jocelyn owns and manages a farm where she grows and sells vegetables. She joined GDMPC in 2007. 

Jocelyn is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to establish a melon crop to generate additional income. She plans to use the profit from her loan to gain more income.

loans.use: to establish a melon crop

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 32-year-old hardworking married man with 2 children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop since 2004 along with a motorcycle transport business as his additional income source. His dream is to have a wholesale shop in town to increase his profit base. Despite the progress, he still faces the challenge of lacking enough funds, due to the fact that most of his customers buy on credit. Robert intends to use the loan to buy more stock, like water, biscuits and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like,water, biscuits and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat is 27 and married with two children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district. Sat and her family earn an income from farming rice and growing cassava. She has been in this business for nine years and earns about 25,000 KHR each day. Sat is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Sat is the leader of a two-member loan group that is requesting its first loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Sat hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Nhor, 56, is married and has seven children. He resides in a rural village in the district of Moung Russey in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

To support the family, he and his wife have been farming rice for 10 years. Their current business earns about 39,000 Cambodian riel per day to meet the family’s needs.

Nhor has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid past loans. His group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. 

Nhor is now leading his group of two in this request for a loan. He will use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yield to make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: El Triunfo (Flat) Ahorros Group

texts.es:
El Triunfo es un grupo integrado por 6 personas y se ubica en Plan de Villa, los principales fuentes de empleo es el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar.
Emma es una de los integrantes del grupo el triunfo, ella tiene la edad de 29 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y es madre soltera de tres pequeños que asisten a la primaria.
Ella platica que siempre había tenido la idea de tener un negocio propio en el cual poder emplearse y así pasar con sus hijos más tiempo y poderles ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella hace 5 meses lograr abrir su tienda de abarrotes, la cual ha puesto en su hogar, ella eligió esta actividad ya que es rentable, no tiene temporadas todos los días hay ventas.
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es tratar con la gente, además de que aunque esta empezando con su negocio tratar de tenerlo surtiendo con lo que más le pide la gente para ir haciendo clientela.
Este negocio también le ayuda para enseñar a su hijos aunque trabajando es como gana la vida.

Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a invertir en la compra de sopa, café, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, galletas,  detergentes, dulces, productos enlatados y refrescos para resurtir su tienda.
A futuro espera poder brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una profesión y que su negocio progrese.

Los demás integrantes de grupo son:
Petra-Venta de Ropa.
Heladia-Venta de pollo
Emiliano-Siembra y cultivo de caña
Adriana-Venta de ropa
Gabino-Siembra y cultivo de caña
texts.en:
El Triunfo (Triumph) is a group made up of six people and located in Plan de Villa, where the main source of employment is in the fields planting and growing sugar cane.

Emma is one of the members of El Triunfo group.  She is 29 years old, did not have the opportunity to study, and is the single mother of three small children who are in primary school.  She talks about always having had the idea to have her own business in which she could employ herself and thus spend more time with her children and be able to offer them a better quality of life.

Five months ago she achieved the opening of her grocery store, which she has set up in her house.  She chose this job because it is profitable and does not have seasons; every day she has sales.  What she likes about her job is dealing with people.  Furthermore, although she is just starting her business, she tries to have it well stocked with what the people ask for so that they become customers.  The business also helps her teach her children that working is how one earns a living.

A loan fron VisionFund would allow her to invest in the purchase of soup, coffee, sugar, beans, oil, detergents, sweets, canned goods, and soda, in order to restock her store.  In the future she hopes that she can offer her children the opportunity to study a career, and that her business improves.

The other members of the group are:
Petra - Sells clothing
Heladia - Sells chicken
Emiliano - Plants and grows sugar cane
Adriana - Sells clothing
Gabino - Plants and sells sugar cane

loans.use: to buy soup, coffee, sugar, beans, oil, cookies, detergents, sweets, canned goods, and soda.

location.town: Plan de Villa, Tierra Blanca, Veracruz

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 44 years old, married and has children. They live at Alcala, Cagayan, where most of the residents are farmers who grow corn. Rolando is patiently managing his farming business and hopes to further develop his crops. To make this a reality, he would like to borrow P20,000. This will be used to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. In the future, he hopes to become a successful corn grower and keep saving funds for future family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Susan Gakuri

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old and married to John; they have four children who are in school. She has a quarry business in Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD. to enable her to buy a heifer and also pay school fees. She paid her previous loan successfully. With the anticipated profit, she plans to boost her dairy farming business.
 
She hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET LTD. to enable her to buy many dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a heifer and pay school fees.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and determined. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy a water tank that will benefit four family members. They will be able to store enough clean water for use. She runs an Mpesa (mobile money transfer) shop and cosmetics shop to earn an income. She hopes that in future, she will grow economically. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Melcer

texts.en:
Melcer is a 30-year-old woman from North Sakwa in Migori county, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married  to Mr. Wasonga who is a businessman within the same region, and supports the family. She supports six people in her family. She has four kids who are 12, 10, 8 and 6 years old, respectively.

She has a tailoring stall where she also sells new clothes materials, a business she has been doing for the last six years and makes a monthly income of  12,000 Kes. She has applied for her third loan with KADTE LTD, which she will use to purchase more new clothes materials. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to open a big tailoring center and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more new clothes materials.

loans.name: Leidy Jacqueline

texts.es: Leidy reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo – Ecuador, inicio cobrando el Bono de Desarrollo Humano proporcionado por el Estado, con el cual reunió un capital e inicio su negocio en un local de tres metros cuadrados, en base a mucho esfuerzo y deseo de superación ha logrado mantener su negocio el mismo que lo atiende desde las 6:30 hasta las 19:00, el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de mas mercadería, su sueño para los cinco próximos años es tener un local mas amplio, comprar un vehículo.
texts.en: Leidy lives in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador.  She started with aid, a development bonus, from the state.  With that, she got together some money, and started her business at a place that is three square meters.  Based on a lot of effort and the desire for improvement, she has managed to maintain her business. She works at her business from 6:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  The loan is to buy more merchandise.  Her dream for the next five years is to have a large place and to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy more consumable goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water dispenser and a fridge.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, has been raising pigs for years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. She’s 59 years old now, yet continues to hang on to her piggery livelihood to give an adequate living for her four children. 

She's been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In order to renovate the livestock shelter, she is borrowing an amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit. Melodina hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to renovates the livestock shelter.

loans.name: Melsa

texts.en: Melsa is 37 years old, married to Mathew, and blessed with four children aged 20, 16, 10 and 5 years. She sells fish, a business she started 13 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. She has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more fish for sale. The profit she earns will be ploughed back into to her business. Her dream is to see this business expand. She also hopes for a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat and her husband are rice farmers and fisher-people. They have been married since 1995 and have three daughters. Two are garment workers and the other attends school. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophat had applied for a Kiva loan previously. She is asking for her second loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

In the photo are Sophat and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en: Bruno is a forty-seven-year-old married man with seven children. Four of them go to school. He currently lives in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years he has practiced agriculture and also runs a workshop business to earn some additional income. Bruno started the business to sustain his family and with the proceeds, he has educated his children. He hopes to expand his workshop to different areas and improve his banana plantation. However, price fluctuations and seasonal changes are challenges he faces. Bruno intends to use the loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation by adding fertilizers.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation by adding fertilizers.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, 42, is married with three children. She lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.

Fe catches fish for a living and has been doing so for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. 

Fe has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years. In the future, she hopes to save enough for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 36-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He offers laundry services such as washing clothes and earns a living from this. He also earns a salary as a civil servant as his additional income. 

With his meager salary, he has been able to educate his children and own a washing machine. He wishes to be a self-sustainable man and to build a home for his family. High competition and customers failing to pay on time are his major challenges. 

Nicholas is requesting a loan to buy another washing machine.

loans.use: to buy another washing machine.

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en: Ebrahim is a 28-year-old man. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. Ebrahim's business is a grocery store that he started four years ago with limited capital. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Though he has been working hard, he can't meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him grocery supplies. He managed to attract more clients. He was happy about attracting new clients but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business's progress and growth. So, he took out a loan of 400,000 YER in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
Sydney works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Sydney requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Sydney would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 43 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 4 hijos. El negocio de Rosa consiste en la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, pan, huevos entre otros. Su tienda ofrece varios productos reconocidos. Al principio Rosa no contaba con tantos productos en su negocio, sin embargo buscó una solución y poco a poco fue implementando su pequeña tienda, y ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, espera ver crecer a su negocio y que este le brinde mejores ingresos económicos. En este préstamo con Kiva está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto de S/. 2,000 comprará mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, panes entre otros ingredientes por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old, married, and lives in her own house along with her husband and four children.  Rosa's business consists of selling food products like rice, bread, and eggs, among others.  Her shop offers many recognized products.  At the beginning, Rosa did not have many products in her business; nevertheless she found a solution and little by little she added to her small store.  Now her sales are going very well.  What she most likes about her job is talking to her customers and seeing them begin the day with a smile.  She hopes to see her business grow and give her a greater income.  

With this loan, she is grateful to Kiva and is happy knowing that she can continue getting the financial support that she needs to advance the progress of her business.  With the amount of 2,000 PEN she will buy a greater quantity of products like rice, sugar, and bread, among other ingredients for her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other ingredients for her customers.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan, age 30 and unmarried, runs a small restaurant in his village. He established his business in August of 2011. He has a strong reputation in his community and is well-known for his specialized sandwiches and hookahs. His establishment is known for its cleanliness and the high quality of its products. He puts a great deal of effort into providing his customers with the best service possible.
 
He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy an ice cream machine. This investment will increase his revenue and help him to expand his business, which is his dream.
 
Marwan is planning to move his restaurant to a better location where he can attract more customers and offer them a place to sit and enjoy their delicious meals.

loans.use: to buy an ice cream machine for his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Abejitas De Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Kusachan de Pilcopata” en la ciudad de Pilcopata. 
Alberto tiene 51 años de edad es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos, él y sus hijos viven en la comunidad nativa de Santa Rosa de Huacaria que está ubicado en la ciudad de Pilcopata del distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo, Perú.  (En la fotografía el cliente está levantando la mano). 

Alberto es Chaman y sanador de la comunidad nativa de Huacaria, él es hijo del chamán sanador, mestizo de dos etnias, machiguenga y huachipaire, nativas de la selva de El Manu. 

Alberto es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de medicinas tradicional amazónica pues lo hace en base a plantas naturales de la selva del Perú entonces en esta oportunidad Alberto requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como herramientas, envases, ollas y también para comprar alcohol para hacer maseras las plantas para producir pomadas y frotaciones.  
  
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta y compra de madera, a la reparación de motocicletas,  a brindar servicio de transportes, a la elaboración de artesanía. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The lending group “Kusachan de Pilcopata” is composed of friends and neighbors from the city of Pilcopata. 

Alberto is 51 years old and married. As fruit of this beautiful relationship, he has 6 children. He and his children live in the indigenous community of Santa Rosa de Huacaria, located in the city of Pilcopata, Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, Perú. In the photograph, Alberto is raising his hand. 

Alberto is the shaman and healer in the indigenous community of Huacaria. He is the son of a shaman healer, mestizo of two ethnicities – Machiguenga and Huachipaire – native groups from the El Manu rainforest. Alberto is a charismatic and friendly person who is always pushing forward. His main economic activity is making traditional Amazonian medicines. He does it using natural plants from the Peruvian rain forest. In this loan opportunity, Alberto needs the loan to purchase working materials such as tools, packaging, pots, and also to purchase alcohol to make plant extractions for ointments and poultices for massaging injuries. 

This lending group is composed of several people that are constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead, and with their daily effort, provide a better future for their children. The members work in agriculture, buying and selling wood, repairing motorcycles, offering transportation services, and making artisan crafts. The members are thankful for the opportunity provided and promise to complete the payments for their different loans within the established time period.

loans.use: purchase work materials such as tools, packaging, pots, and alcohol

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her early 40s, is a divorcee with two children who are still going to school.  She has been a food vendor for one year now.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Nuru's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food items. At first, she used to buy just a few kilos of every item, like 5 kilos of rice, two bottles of cooking oil, two cartons of juice, 5 kilos of wheat flour, 3 kilos of flour for making porridge, and small items that were out of stock. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used her profit to renovate her late mother's house and contribute to household expenses. She will use this loan to buy 15 kilos of rice, 5 kilos of beans, a small bucket of cooking oil, 10 kilos of sugar, 10 kilos of baking flour, and 15 cartons of juice. She dreams of building her own house.

Nuru will share this loan with her loan group, Rufiji, which has 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, baking flour, and juice.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
This is Jerry, 42, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. He is married to Elvira, an employee, and they have four children. He manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jerry operates a poultry supply store where he sells different supplies mostly for cocks. He sells the supplies by the kilo and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more feed and other supplies needed to expand his product inventory.

Jerry dreams of continuously expanding his business and hopes that his whole family will have good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. There, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more feed and other supplies needed to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina (in the photo), age 22, is a garment worker. Her husband Chanra, age 25, is an electrician. They have been married since 2010 and have only one young child. The family is living in a Phnom Penh suburb. 
Nowadays, Lina stays with her parents. She wants to live in a separate home so she decided to ask for a loan to build her own house to live in and to fill in the land around her house.

loans.use: to build her own house and to fill in the land around her house.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a fish vendor from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband have a one-year-old baby and a four-year-old child. Clara's husband works as a farmer. They combine their incomes to support the family.
 
Clara is requesting a loan in order to buy more fish, crabs, and shrimp to sell. With this investment, she will be able to sell more, thus augmenting her sales and increasing her income. 

In the future, Clara dreams of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children. She is committed to the timely repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to buy  fish, crabs, and shrimp to offer for sale

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita, 49, is married with four children. She lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Perlita is engaged in snack vending activity and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her food and snack processing and retailing business. She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost nine years. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food processing and vending business

loans.name: Chanthet

texts.en:
Chanthet, age 26 and unmarried, earns an income by selling rice and other food items in front of a garment factory. His customers are the garment workers who are employed there. 

Chanthet lives with his widowed mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 in order to purchase his own motorcycle so that he can transport his goods to the selling place. He needs this because he has been using a relative's motorcycle and it is not always available. He will use his loan funds to purchase a motorbike and a trailer that will connect at the back, which will allow him to more efficiently transport rice and food items to the factory.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport rice and food items to offer for sale

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita, 43 years old, is married, and she and her husband were blessed with four children. She owns and manages a food stall business where she sells snacks in her village. She is glad that she can earn a daily income of 500 PHP. She would like to improve her business by asking for additional capital of 15,000 PHP to purchase bread, fish balls, squid balls, and chicken balls to sell. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that she can continue to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bread, fish balls, squid balls, and chicken balls to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, age 56, sells rice to earn a living. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for eight years. She and her husband have three children.

Lilia has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy an additional sack of rice.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, age 48, operates a food stall to earn an income. She sells fried chicken and spring rolls, which are in high demand especially at lunch and dinner times. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 900 in sales each day.

Maria and her husband Diego live in Intramuros, Manila, with their two children. Diego is her partner in the business. Together, they manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her food stall venture, Maria is requesting a PhP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan funds to buy chicken, minced pork, and other ingredients needed in her business.

Maria hopes that her enterprise will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her family will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy chicken, minced pork, and other ingredients needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a structure from which she can offer her commodities for sale

loans.name: 03.03.09 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood for woodworking. Loan has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Loan is 31 years old and she is married with two children. Loan lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Loan is the group leader of the 03.03.09 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Loan first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase wood for woodworking.

loans.name: 3.8.303.15.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future. Hiền  has been involved in this business for 6 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hiền is 40 years old and she is married with one child. Hiền supports one dependent. with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hiền is the group leader of the 3.8.303.15.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Jambo

texts.en:
Jambo, aged 36 years, is married with five school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

He has operated an agricultural selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of disease outbreaks and pests affecting his crops.

With the KES 30,000 loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on his farm. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on his farm.

loans.name: Mwambaji

texts.en:
Mwambaji is a single man who lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food and water. 

For the past three years, he has operated an agricultural selling business, selling produce from his home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. He dreams of expanding his business to generate more income. 

With the loan that he is requesting of KES 30,000 he wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Anh's Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and expand her clothes shop.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Trinidad, Bohol. Demetria is engaged in rice farming business together with her husband. This is their source of income. 

Demetria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and educational supplies for her children. With this, she will be able to improve her business and continue sending her children to school. Demetria hopes to make her farming business a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and educational supplies for her children.

loans.name: 3.8.302.14.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling metals. She is requesting a loan to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell. Hương has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hương is 31 years old and she is married with one child. Hương supports one dependent. with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hương is the group leader of the 3.8.302.14.Thiệu Toán  solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman and has been blessed with five children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Ega operates a meat goat-selling business, selling from home to neighbours and passersby, her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 50,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase seven goats for resale to her customers. In this way, she can get more profit to help her boost the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 7 goats for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh, age 64, and her husband breed cattle, chickens, ducks, and pigs to earn a living. She is a hard-working woman who has been engaged in this business for 22 years. For additional income, she grows rice and sells eggs. Their income is about 7,000,000 VND per month. They have raised four children, all of whom are now married.

Tinh's primary business challenge is the lack of money to buy cattle feed and the fact that the income from selling eggs is low. Her dream is to have a bigger and cleaner farm. This loan is one step toward helping her reach this dream. With the loan, she will buy more ducks and build more cotes. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid her loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND in order to build more cotes and buy more chicken feed.

Other members who are part of Tinh’s group include the following:

Nga, age 54, sells groceries. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,528,000 VND to invest in her business. She has two children.

Lu, age 23, is a carpenter. She would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to invest in her business. She has three children.

Nghi , age 44, sells vegetables and fruits in the market. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to invest in her business. She has four children. 

Tuan, age 39, breeds chickens. He is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to buy chicken feed. He has five children.

loans.use: to build cotes and buy chicken feed

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho is 32 years old. She has three children who are learning at primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a doctor who specializes in Oriental medicine. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She is a kindergarten teacher. Her income is about 7,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for nine years. Her family’s income is about 12,000,000 VND per month. 

Besides that, Tho also raises chickens to earn more money. Her challenge in work is the lack of capital to raise more chickens. Her dream is to have a larger chicken farm. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. 

Tho is a hardworking woman. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more food for her chickens. 

She wants to gain earnings and save profit to buy land to enlarge her farm and support her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy more food for her chickens.

loans.name: Crisostomo

texts.en:
Crisostomo is a motorcycle driver from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and has three young children, ages 6, 5 and 2 years old. He also operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place.

Crisostomo is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle and additional stock to sell in his store, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, among others. With this, he will be able to improve his business as well as his income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motorcycle and additional stock to sell in his store, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 59 years old, is married to a farmer and they have four children. She has been in the livestock business in their village for 30 years and is still doing well. She is happy that she can still earn a net income of PHP 2,500 for every hog that she can sell.  

She wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase feed to sustain the needs of her hogs. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted by the lenders so she can fulfill her plans for her business and her family with the income she will generate.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 29 years old and married with two children. She does dairy farming in Kangundo town and she sells and supplies milk to dairy shops in the area. She has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable. Besides dairy farming, she also has a retail shop.

This is her second loan term from KADET Ltd. and she plans to use the loan amount to buy feeds for her dairy cows. She also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop. These goods include rice, sugar, salt and maize flour. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Jacinta hopes to buy more dairy cows as well as grow her retail shop business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed and a stock of goods to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase more medicine for reselling.

Dung is 51 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the Nhóm 03 Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ solidarity group. Her children are grown up, so Dung supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline, tiene 28 años, está casada y  vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Jackeline  se dedica a  la venta de gaseosas y cervezas, actividad que realiza en la casa de sus padres donde instaló un pequeño bar. Tiene una refrigeradora concedida por la empresa distribuidora en donde coloca cada una de las bebidas para su congelamiento. Cuenta con el apoyo de su madre cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite cuidar a su pequeño hijo. Viendo lo lucrativo que es el negocio por la demanda que tiene, desea continuar con esta actividad y ampliarlo aún más abriendo una tienda en donde pueda vender otro tipo de productos orientados a este mismo rubro. En este préstamo con Kiva Jackeline está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.  Se compromete a ser puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado de S/. 3800 comprará gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor de variadas marcas y presentaciones.
texts.en: Jackeline is 28 years old. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. Jackeline sells sodas and beer in her parents' house, where she installed a small bar. She has a refrigerator given by the distribution company where she puts each one of the drinks to chill them. She has the support of her mother when she is not at home. She likes the business since it lets her care for her young son. Given how lucrative the business is and the demand that she has, she wants to continue with this activity and expand it even more, opening a store where she can sell other kinds of products in the same line. Jackeline is very happy to know that in this loan with Kiva she has financial backing to continue advancing in the achievement of her goals. She promises to be punctual with each one of her repayments. With the amount requested of 3800 nuevos soles, she will buy an assortment of brands and varieties of wholesale sodas and beer.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sodas and other drinks for her store

loans.name: 020101  Thôn 3 - Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tấn works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell. Tấn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tấn faces in her business is the lack of capital. Tấn supports one dependent. with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a five-member group, the 020101 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Đông solidarity group. In 2002, Tấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tấn has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Tấn hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

loans.name: Geradio

texts.en:
Geradio runs a sari-sari or variety store in his place in Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income. 

Geradio is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, cooking seasonings and others. With this, he will be able to expand the variety in his store and attract more buyers thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda and her husband are farmers living in Alcala, Cagayan. They plant and harvest corn to sell. They also hire laborers who helped them do farming activities. 

Glenda would like to increase her yield but had insufficient funds. This made her borrow a loan from the lenders of an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy pesticides and fertilizers needed in their farming business.

She is hoping that the business will continue to prosper so they can save more for their future.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Narty

texts.en:
Narty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Narty has been in this business for 10 years. Narty earns more income from fishing.

Narty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Berlinda

texts.en:
This is Ma. Berlinda, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romerico, a worker abroad, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Berlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Berlinda dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gesica

texts.en:
A 29-year-old woman, Gesica is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Gesica is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, sugar, milk, candy, etc. for her general store business.

Gesica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, sugar, milk and candy.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu, age 50, sells vegetables from her grocery stall to earn a living. She sells her goods at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her venture and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

Mariamu and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she has requested, she intends to pay her children's school fees so that she can ensure their continued education.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a 40-year-old married father of five children, is a hardworking Iraqi client. He, along with two of his children, provide the family's income.

Ahmad owns a small grocery store where he sells canned food, snacks and detergents. He used to work with his friends at a grocery store, but in 2010, after gaining enough experience in this field, he established his own business in his neighborhood, becoming well-known and well-regarded since he is the only grocer in the area.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD, to buy two new refrigerators and an air-conditioner. He believes that this loan will help him to increase sales and profits. Ahmad hopes to educate his children and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators and an air-conditioner

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has a business selling motorcycle spare parts in the Philippines. In business for nine years now, she has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is an Iraqi youth client, who is 19 years old and lives with his family composed of nine members. Ahmad has seven brothers and sisters, of whom four assist Mouhammad in providing the family living.

Mouhammad is a barber. At his young age, Mouhammad has worked at several barber shops and has worked hard to learn this career and master it. After successfully gaining all the needed experience in this field, Mouhammad established his own independent business in 2012, and has amazed his neighborhood with his skills. Mouhammad now has a hired employee and is well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of 2,100 USD in order to buy a motor generator, an air-conditioner and install signage for his barber shop. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide himself a good and stable career.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator, an air-conditioner and install signage for his barber shop.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a farmer in the remote village of Kanyaryeru in the Kiruhura district. A married father of four children who are all in school, Stephen started cattle farming at the early age of 12, as it was the main economic activity in his village. After the death of his father when he was 20 years of age, he worked hard to take care of his mother through cattle farming until he started his own family.

Stephen has now started constructing a semi-permanent house to accommodate his mother and the family. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 shillings to complete his house; he will be using proceeds from the farm to service the requested loan.

loans.use: To complete  construction of his house

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, a 29-year-old married mother of one child, has been selling fish with her husband for the last seven years. Hanan is well known in her region, enjoying a good reputation for the hard work she puts into helping her husband in marketing and selling their products among the nearby villages. Selling fish from their van, they cover as many villages as they can each day.

Hanan is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to perform necessary maintenance on her house before the winter season; they had some house problems during the last winter season, and this is the perfect time to perform the maintenance.

Hanan hopes to keep on expanding their working zone and increasing their revenue to make sure their only child will achieve a better education than the one he is currently receiving in the public school.

loans.use: To perform necessary maintenance on her house

loans.name: Suot

texts.en:
Suot is 53 years old. She has three children who are adults. Suot is a widow. She grows rice and raises pigs. She makes 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. She has done this job for 30 years. Her challenges in life and work are lacking knowledge of breeding techniques, and severe weather that makes her animals get diseases. 

Her dream is to save enough money for her retirement. This loan is one of the steps helping her to reach this dream. She can invest in her farm to gain earnings and save profit for caring for her health. 

Suot is a hardworking woman. She enjoys her job of raising pigs. Suot has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to save more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: 03.02.05 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

Dung is 29 years old, and she is married with one child. Dung is the group leader of the 03.02.05 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. Dung lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her child to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

loans.name: Hanh's Group
loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francis, a driver, and is a mother to her four children. Together with her husband and children she manages their own business while sustaining their everyday expenses.

Emily operates a school jeepney service for students. What happens is that the parents of the students pay a monthly fee and then every day, the driver will pick up the students from their homes and bring them to school; the same thing once school ends. She earns a minimum of PHP 650 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and carry out maintenance of their jeepney unit. 

Emily hopes to have a bigger school service and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 58 years old, married, and his four children are all adults. He is a business man, owning a retail shop Koibatek town, and has been in operation for over a period of eight years earning an income of KES 6,000.

He has borrowed fourth loan of KES 80,000 from KADET Ltd. after he successfully repaid the previous loan. He wishes to purchase more stock of sugar, tea leaves and washing detergents among other goods for resale.  

The anticipated profit will be used as savings for future investments. He hopes to live a balanced life.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna, aged 37 years, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Analinda

texts.en:
Analinda is 48 years old and married with four children.

Analinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, bread, etc.

Analinda has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Analinda aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap and bread.

loans.name: Mwanyikombo

texts.en:
Mwinyikombo, aged 65 years, is a married man and has seven kids who attend school. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mwinyikombo has operated a farming business for the past six years. His potential clients are neighbours and passersby. He dreams of expanding to large-scale farming in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 he wants to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests.

loans.name: Emalinda

texts.en:
Emalinda is 49 years old and married; she works hard to help her husband generate additional income for the family to sustain their needs.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport.  Emalinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Emalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine lives in Vanadzor town in the Lori region with her three children. She runs a little farm which includes 30 chickens and 4 cows. Her daughter, Arevik (in the photo), studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University after Khachatur Abovyan.

 The farming business is the only source of income for Hermine and her two sons, who help her with agricultural activities and do their best to sustain the family. The university where Hermine’s daughter studies is located in Yerevan, so Hermine has to rent a house for her daughter to live there. Hermine also has to provide her daughter with the necessary financial means to cover daily costs. All these costs do not allow Hermine to make savings to pay for the university tuition fee. 

She has requested this loan for paying university tuition to give to her daughter to complete her education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a hard-working youth client from Iraq. He is 26 years old and lives with his parents and his three brothers. Ali, along with his father and two of his brothers, provides the family living and the school fees for the youngest child.

Ali owns a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, snacks, dairy products and detergents. He established his business in 2011 and has gained good experience in this field. Ali has an excellent reputation in the neighborhood and has a hired employee.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD to renovate his grocery store and to increase his inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide himself and his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita, de 55 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Marcial, con quien tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Hace 20 años perteneció a un proyecto ganadero, por lo que adquirió todo el conocimiento para obtener una buena crianza de animales. Es por esa razón que en la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de vacas, posee 15 ejemplares, las cuales cuida con mucho esmero, además de ovejas de calidad. Su principal trabajo se centra en alimentarlas para que brinden una buena leche, pues gracias a ella elabora queso que vende a buen precio en su mismo pueblo, que es reconocido por la buena calidad de productos lácteos que poseen. Ahora desea seguir mejorando la calidad de sus animales, para obtener una mejor ganancia y así asegurar su vejes. Este es su cuarto crédito con kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Edita, invertirá los S/.3OO soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Edita, 55 years old, is a simple woman. She lives with her husband Marcial. They have six children, two of whom live with them in their home.  Twenty years ago she joined a ranching project, through which she obtained all the knowledge needed to provide her animals with sound care.  Currently, she raises fifteen cows as well as some sheep, and she provides them with painstaking care.  Her primary work consists of feeding them such that they yield good milk, and Edita is able to make cheese, which she sells for a good price in her home town. She is well known for her high quality dairy products. 

She wishes to continue to improve the quality of her animals so that she can earn greater income and be comfortable in her old age. This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she has received. She continues to strive to get ahead and promises to repay the loan in a punctual manner. Edita will invest S/.300 soles in the purchase of a balanced diet for her animals.

loans.use: purchase a balanced diet for her animals.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is already a widower and is a father of four; his one and only daughter assists him in managing their farm while his three sons are working in a government office.  

Agustin grows rice and corn in their field. His wish to maintain his yield made him take out a loan of P30,000 to buy herbicides and fertilizers and to pay the labor cost during planting season.  He dreams that his children will all have a good life.  He is also hoping for a good harvest every year.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers and pay for the labor cost during planting season.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 41-old-married woman and the mother of five children. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

Helen earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home cooked food to the people in her area; this is the source of her income. Her husband works as a farmer.

Helen is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her food vending like vegetables, meat, and rice, and for school supplies for her children.

In the future, Helen hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending like vegetables, meat, and rice, and for school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 47-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Ruth has provided for the needs of her three children from the little amount of 14,000 she has earned monthly from her Tupperware business over the years; this adds to the income earned by her husband. 

In 2010, she became a member of GDMPC; she is applying for a loan from GDMPC micro finance for 55,000 PHP to buy more Tupperware items to sell. 

Ruth wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware items to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 36 years, is married and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenge in her business. 

Mary is requesting Kshs 25,000 to boost her kiosk, purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat . She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga, de 59 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo Felipe, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años. Dominga se dedica a la crianza de vacas, posee un total de 15 ejemplares, además de ovejas de buena calidad. Gracias a la producción de leche que obtiene, puede elaborar queso en cantidad, por lo que comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de queso y carne a una ciudad cercana, pues tiene muchos clientes y la demanda se incrementa constantemente. “Me va muy bien en mi trabajo, pues existen días en las que no me abastezco con mi propia producción y tengo que comprar a otros ganaderos”, afirma. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Dominga, invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de queso y carne por cantidad; para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Dominga, 59, is a joyful woman. She lives with her husband, Felipe, with whom she has five children. However, she only lives with two of them in a house that they have rented for two years. Dominga works raising cattle. She has 15 total, in addition to good-quality sheep. Thanks to the milk that she gets, she can make cheese in bulk, which is why she started working selling cheese and meat in a nearby city. She has many customers and demand is growing constantly. "Things are going well for me in my work; there are days where my own production is not enough and I have to buy from other ranchers," she says. She is on her second loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to move forward. She promises to make her payments on time. Dominga will invest her S/. 300 soles in the purchase of cheese and meat in bulk to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese and meat.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a rice grower. He has a 1.5 hectare rice field and he has been cultivating his land for two years. Aside from farming, he is also engaged in a hog-raising business where he raises 20 piglets. Gerald is married and his wife owns and manages a vending business selling variety of agricultural supplies. 

The couple works hard to support the education of their two children and to save for their family's future. Gerald would like to improve his rice field by proper application of farm supplies to his rice crop. For him to achieve his goals, he is now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay laborers who help him during the planting period.  

Gerald hopes and prays that his requested loan will be granted so he can further secure his family future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide and pay laborers.

loans.name: Vald´z Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Vald´z está conformado por tres integrantes que son familiares y viven en la misma comunidad. La fiesta más grande de dicha comunidad es cuando celebran al señor San Antonio el día 13 de Junio. Don Apolonio tiene 45 años de edad está casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Francisca juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos de los cuales dos aún dependen de dicha pareja y se encuentran estudiando su educación primaria. 

Don Apolonio se dedica a la venta de fantasía y mercería desde hace 20 años platica como inicio su actividad “Yo trabajaba como empleado en un negocio grande me gusto mucho la venta de estos artículos y fue como inicie la venta”. Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más artículos de mercería, fantasía y materia prima para la elaboración de los accesorios que él crea: moños muy llamativos y bonitos para adornar el cabello de las niñas y jovencitas. Comenta que nunca asistió a un curso para aprender a elaborar los moños aprendió practicando todos los días, su trabajo es muy bueno se esmera mucho para que los moños de las niñas duren mucho tiempo. Don Apolonio vende sus artículos en los tianguis recorre todos los rincones para así obtener un poquito más de ganancias. Le gusta mucho tener trato con las personas por eso se esfuerza para dar un muy buen servicio. La única dificultad es cuando las autoridades no lo dejan vender en los tianguis; en la mayoría de los lugares en los que vende les exigen una cuota para poder trabajar. A pesar de esto, a Don Apolonio le gustaría llegar a fabricar sus artículos de fantasía y tener las herramientas necesarias pero también es necesario tomar algunos cursos para aprender a crear otros accesorios. El grupo está muy agradecido con VisionFund y Kiva por la oportunidad de recibir un crédito ya que los tres podrán seguir invirtiendo en sus actividades económicas como Eliud invertirá en su taller mecánico y Doña María invertirá  en la compra de maíz para la venta de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
The Vald'z Group is made up of three members who are related and live in the same community. This community's largest festival is when they celebrate Saint Anthony on June 13. Apolonio is 45 years old. He has been married for some time to Francisca. Together they started a family with six children, of which two are still dependent on the couple and are primary school students.

Apolonio has sold notions and sewing items for 20 years. He says of the beginning of his work: "I worked as an employee in a large business. I liked selling these items very much, and that was how I started the shop." This time he is asking for the loan to buy more sewing items, notions, and raw material for the production of the accessories he makes: very striking and pretty ribbons to adorn young girls' hair. He says that he never took a course to learn how to make the ribbons. He learned by practicing every day. His work is very good, and he takes great pains to ensure the girls' ribbons last a long time. Apolonio sells his items in the street markets and goes around to each corner in order to earn a little bit more. He likes dealing with people very much, so he makes an effort to provide very good service. The only difficulty is when the authorities don't let him sell at the street markets; in the majority of the places where he sells, they demand a fee in order to be able to work. Despite this, Apolonio likes to make his notions and to have the necessary tools, but it is also necessary to take some courses to learn to make other accessories. The group is very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for the opportunity to receive a loan since the three of them can continue investing in their economic activities. Eliud will invest in his mechanic shop and María will buy corn for selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy sewing items and raw material to make his ribbons

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa, from Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte, is 45 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Nimfa has been running a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community for years now, earning 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Nimfa joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional frozen products like chicken, tapa, corned beef, etc to sell in her frozen products business.

Jennifer has been in this business for five years. Jennifer earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen products like chicken, tapa and corned beef to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has operated a kiosk business from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase iron sheets to construct her house. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to construct her house.

loans.name: Gloria Jamileth

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 31 años de edad es madres de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y en compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedican a la agricultura especialmente a lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde muy pequeña esta actividad ya que en su familia es su único medio de ingreso económico para cubrir las diferentes necesidades como ser: vestimenta, alimentación, medicinas con muchas restricciones, entre otros. El terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja cultiva es propio ya que sus padres le heredaron un pedazo de tierra para que ella pudiese trabajar y pudiese tener un ingreso. Ella en la actualidad quiere proteger y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos para evitar que sean infectados por la roya o por la broca que es un bicho dañino y destructor.

Gloria ha solicitado aun financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos como: urea, abono, herbicidas, fertilizantes entre otros para proteger su cosecha de café.

Sus planes para el futuro es poder expandir sus cultivos por medio de la compra de tierra para poder cultivar más café y generar más ingresos para su familia y para su hogar. Ella también sueña con darle a sus hijos la mejor educación, verlos crecer y graduados universitaria mente.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old and the mother of two young children. She and her partner plant and raise coffee.  Gloria's parents taught her about cultivating coffee from a very young age, since it was her family's only source of income and the only way to cover necessary expenses such as clothing, food, hard-to-obtain medicines, and others.  

The land that she and her partner grow on is their own, as her parents gave them a piece of ground that she could work and earn income from. Currently she wishes to protect and preserve her crops, making sure that they don't become blighted or infected by the borer, a damaging, destructive insect.

Gloria has requested financing through the COMIXMUL cooperative to purchase supplies such as urea, manure, herbicides, and fertilizers among other things to protect her coffee harvest.

Her plans for the future include expanding her planting through the purchase of additional land. More land will mean more coffee and greater income for her family and her home. She dreams of giving her children a better education, seeing them grow and graduate from college.

loans.use: purchase supplies to help her grow coffee.

loans.name: Khourp's Group

texts.en:
A successful mother of six children residing in Battambang province, Khourp is an industrious farmer who does rice cropping on two hectares. The current business brings her about 38,300 KHR per day. 

Khourp has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for five cycles and she has successfully paid them all back. The past loan has improved her family’s living conditions and made them better, so she feels confident to take a new loan with VisionFund. 

Now she and her one group member are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can increase income from her current business and build a new house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, de 37 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Magno, con quien tuvo 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Eva se dedica a la ganaderia pero tambien vende productos comestibles en un pequeño puesto que acondicionó al frente de su hogar. Le va muy bien en su negocio pues también aprovecha vender el queso que elabora gracias a la leche que producen sus vacas. Pues la principal actividad económica de Eva, es la crianza de vacas y ovejas en cantidad, esto lo desarrolla gracias a la ayuda de su esposo, quien los alimenta y cuida en las alturas, donde se instalan chozas provisionales muy acogedoras por varias semanas. Ahora desea seguir con el mejoramiento de sus animales, para obtener buenos resultados. Confiesa que su secreto es alimentarlos con pastos naturales. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero qye recibe para seguir adelante.
Eva, invertirá los S/. 300 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales
texts.en:
Eva, 37 years old, is a simple woman. She and her husband Magno have three children, only one of whom still lives at home with them.  Eva works in cattle ranching, and she also sells consumable goods in a small stand that she built in front of her home. Her business is going very well, and thanks to the milk she gets from her cows, she is also able to sell cheese.  Her main economic activity is the care of a number of cows and sheep. She is able to do this thanks to the support of her husband, who feeds and cares for them in the high pastures, where they have built some temporary, but cozy, huts that are in use for several weeks. 

She now wishes to improve her animals to get even better results. She admits that her secret is to feed them only natural grasses. This is her fourth credit with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that helps keep her moving forward.

Eva will invest S/.300 soles in the purchase of nutritious foods for her animals.

loans.use: purchase a balanced diet for her animals.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 26 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Jessica se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde comenzó a sembrar productos regionales. Lo que más le gusta a Jessica, es dedicar la mayor parte del día a sus sembríos de café y plátanos. Ya tienen 2 años dedicándose a ello.
