With the loan Luis Alfonso is soliciting through the Corporation, he wishes to purchase a selection of supplies at wholesale, including shoe polish of different colors and shoe shining brushes. He will receive significant discounts that, subsequently, he can invest in more products and, in this manner, increase his personal income.

His major dream is to have his own stand in the principal park where he could improve his level of services and, as a result, increase the profits that this activity can earn for him.

loans.use: buy a selection of supplies at wholesale, including shoe polish of different colors and shoe shining brushes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Huberman De Jesús

texts.es: Huberman de Jesús es un hombre de 38 años de edad, padre cabeza de hogar, tiene un hijo de 10 años. Desde pequeño le ha gustado todo los que tiene que ver con artesanías en madera y en la institución donde estudió en su juventud fue donde aprendió la ebanistería. Hace algún tiempo montó su propio taller de ebanistería, con lo que ha generado ingresos para sostener a su pequeño hijo y apoyar económicamente a sus padres. Con el crédito desea realizar unas mejoras locativas en su negocio, arreglar el techo porque cuando llueve se le filtra el agua y no le permite seguir laborando y adicionalmente pretende comprar materiales como madera y aglomerados para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes. Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y consolidarlo como un taller de ebanistería versátil y moderna, ampliar su espacio de trabajo y de esta forma tener mayor volumen de ventas, que le generen ingresos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y a sus padres.
texts.en:
Huberman de Jesús is a 38 year old man. He is the head of his household, and he has ten year old son. Since he was little, he has liked everything that has to do with wood crafts. In the school where he studied in his youth, he learned woodworking. 

Some time ago he set up his own workshop, which has been generating income to economically support his small son and his parents. With this credit, Huberman de Jesús hopes to make improvements to his place of business. He wants to fix the roof because water leaks when it rains, which keeps him from working, and he also intends to purchase materials like wood and wood glues to carry out pending orders. 

His biggest dream is to make his business grow and to establish it as a versatile and modern woodworking shop. He wants to increase his work space so that he can have a bigger volume of sales and generate more income to offer his son and his parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: make improvements on his place of business, to fix the roof so that it doesn't leak water, and to buy materials such as wood and glue.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 46 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Felicita se dedica a la agricultura, pues gracias al tiempo que pasa en sus cultivos, puede tener una buena cosecha en cada campaña agrícola. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátano; los cuales vende en su misma localidad a los comerciantes mayoristas que llegan los días martes y jueves. Ella se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que está obteniendo; su principal anhelo es cultivar más productos agrícolas de la zona. Y ya dio el primer paso con la siembra de palta y cítricos, el cual está creciendo sin mayores dificultades y ya muy pronto darán sus primeros frutos. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante. Felicita, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Felicita is 46 years old. She is married, and she has three children who live at home. Felicita works in agriculture, and thanks to the time she spends on her crops, she can have a good harvest in each growing season. Her main crops consist of coffee and plantains, which she sells in her city to wholesalers who come on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

Felicita feels very satisfied because of the results she's getting. Her main goal is to cultivate more agricultural products from the area, and she's already taken the first step with the avocado and citrus plantings, which are growing without much difficulty and will very soon produce their first fruits. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful to receive financial help that allows her to keep getting ahead. Felicita will invest 1,000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 37 years old and single. He is a poultry farmer in Tala town where he sells chickens and eggs. He has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable. He currently makes a monthly income of 23,000 Kenya Shillings.

This will be his fourth loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy more poultry feed for his chickens. He also plans to buy more chickens for rearing. He will use the generated profits to buy still more poultry.

He hopes to grow his business and supply poultry and eggs to various customers in the area.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and chickens for rearing.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and their children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leticia dreams that her success will continue and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 34, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Marianito, a chef. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jennifer operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also has a direct sales business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, as well as frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jennifer hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables as well as other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 48 years old and married with four children, who are in school. Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Letecia has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Letecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa, aged 32 years, is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

She operates a grocery, a vegetable-selling stall, where she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to buy fruit and various kinds of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and various kinds of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is married mother of four children who lives in the Samrong District of Takeo Province. She is 45-years-old and she is a rice farmer. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about US $7 per day and manages to save about US $3 each day after daily expenses. 

Eng has joined VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for one cycle. She completely paid back a past loan which has helped her to support her children’s education. Now she is asking for a loan with VisionFund to pay for her son’s university tuition. She hopes this loan will enable her to support her son’s education until graduation and also that it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata, de 31 años, está casada con Nilo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Desde que era joven, se dedicó a la agricultura, actividad que aun realiza pero hace 10 años atrás abrió su tienda de comestibles en donde vende bebidas , arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, desde ese momento brinda una buena atención y sobre todo productos de calidad a sus clientes. Esto la llevo a adquirir cada día más ganancias, además Fortunata, vende su producción de frutas a la capital, pero sin descuidar su negocio; en donde tiene pensado invertir más dinero, en la mejora de su infraestructura. Ya que gracias a su experiencia, afirma que el precio de café que está incrementándose en estos años no durará mucho. Por esa razón desea mejorar e invertir en su negocio.Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Fortunata, invertirá los S/. 300 soles en la compra de productos de comestibles tales como bebidas, arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros.
texts.en: Fortunata, 31 years old, is married to Nilo. They have 2 children, who live with them in their own house. She has worked in agriculture since she was young. She still does this, but 10 years ago she opened a grocery store where she sells drinks, rice, sugar, and milk, among other items. Since that time she has provided good service and, above all, quality products to her customers. This causes her to earn more profit every day. Fortunata also sells the fruit she produces to the capital, but without neglecting her business, in which she plans to invest more money to improve its infrastructure. Thanks to her experience, she asserts that the increase in the price of coffee of the last few years will not last long. For this reason, she wants to improve and invest in her business. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to move forward. She also promises to make her repayments in a punctual manner. Fortunata will use the 300 soles to buy grocery products such as drinks, rice, sugar, and milk, among other items.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married, 61 years of age, and lives in Tinotongan, Tukuran. Mila is operating a 'sari-sari' store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years, and she earns 4,000 PHP every month. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional stock for sale. Mila's business is very stable in her community. . Mila wishes that her business will grow more.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for sale

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline is 29 years old and married with one child. She runs a money transfer business (M-Pesa) in Tala town. She has been in the business for three years. She also sells credit cards and phone accessories.

This will be her second loan term from KADET. She plans to register another money transfer business with the same service provider and also buy an M-Pesa line for the business. She anticipates making more profits, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to become a successful businesswoman and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To register a money transfer business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Magie is a 47 year old resident of Sto.Niño, Tukuran. She has provided for the needs of her 3 children with her earnings of 6,000 PHP each month from fish vending business.

She has been in business for seven years. Her husband as fishes.  Magie joined GDMPC last year and is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing nets. She wants to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 36 years old. She sells meat and has been in the business for six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cows and have some of them slaughtered too provide more meat to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more cows to slaughter in order to sell meat.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Daisy. She is married and has four children aged 15, 12, 10 and 7. She has two additional dependents, who live with her while attending school. 

In 2011, Daisy established her provisions and cosmetics business. She began her business just for self-empowerment. Her business is located at the heart of town, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 650,000 every month from this business. 

Daisy would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Daisy requires a loan in order to buy more provisions for her shop. She hopes that this loan will increase her capital base. In the future, Daisy plans to further increase her stock level. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions and cosmetics

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 38 year-old Mariatu, from Kandeh town in Sierra Leone.  She is married with 5 children between the ages of 4 and 14.  

In 2008, Mariatu established her palm oil business.  Mariatu began her business because she needs to create a source of income to support her children. She works at the business 8 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that her business is growing well.   

Mariatu needs a loan to purchase more palm oil for resale.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more than even.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Yenis Xiomara

texts.es:
Yenis tiene una edad de 25 años con toda una juventud por delante para cumplir sus sueños, sus metas y ser alguien en la vida. En compañía de su pareja tienen un hijo el cual está de meses de nacido. Ella tiene 4 años de educación primaria los cuales pudo cursar gracias al apoyo y esfuerzo de sus padres ya que ellos eran de escasos recurso económicos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra en lo que es la siembra de maíz, frijol y café por lo cual tiene mucha experiencia ya que es una tradición familiar. La tierra que en compañía de su pareja trabajan es propia adquirida por medio de una herencia familiar ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación trasladándose a pie diariamente para su asistencia y mantenimiento.

Yenis ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos que ayudaran a sus cultivos de café a proteger de plagas, bichos, entre otros que dañen la cosecha.  

Sus planes son poder comprar un poco más de tierra para poder cultivar más café u otros granos básicos que ayuden a generar ingresos para su familia y su hogar. Sus metas son los de poder ir poco a poco formando un capital para el estudio de su hijo y que el día de mañana no tenga problemas para que él estudie.
texts.en:
Yenis is 25 years old with all of her youth ahead of her to achieve her dreams and goals and to be someone in life.  She and her partner have a son who is only a few months old.  She has four years of primary education, which she was able to get thanks to her parents' effort and support, as they had few economic resources.  They were the ones who taught her to work the land and grow corn, beans, and coffee, and this family tradition is why she has a lot of experience.  She and her partner inherited the land they work from a relative; it is 2 km from their home and they visit it on foot daily to tend to it and maintain it.

Yenis has asked the COMIXMUL Cooperative for financing to buy supplies that will protect their coffee crops from insect pests, among other things that damage the harvest.

She plans to be able to buy a little more land so she can to grow more coffee or other staple crops that will help generate income for her family and her household.  Her goal is to save up some money little by little for her son to go to school so that when the day comes his education will not be a problem.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop

loans.name: Zayed

texts.en:
Zayed is a 29-year-old married man from Deir el Balah. He has been working on a rickshaw for one year.  Zayed is a hard worker and his job is profitable, but he needs some money to pay the costs of maintenance and licensing the rickshaw. 

Zayed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Zayed to pay the urgent expenses of maintenance and licensing the rickshaw.

Zayed appears in the photo while he was working in the city.

loans.use: to pay the costs of maintenance and licensing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with eight children. She is 45 years old, residing at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for many years.  Each month she earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

She requests a loan of 8,000.00 PHP to purchase canned goods and dairy products for sale. 

Josephine has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and dairy products for sale.

loans.name: Laurecio

texts.en:
Laulencio, 59, is a married man with eight children. He lives in rural setting on the out skirt of Kyotera. Two of his children attend school and he also takes care of his two grand children.

Laulencio is a farmer who grows maize and vegetables.  He has been in this business since 1974 and works six days a week, ten hours per day as an indication of his hard work.  Laulencio started this business due to passion for growing vegetables and availability of land.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops. He sells his products to traders in the city.

Laulencio's dream is to expand his agriculture activities so that he can produce large quantities of food, and he wishes to build a modern house for his family.

His main challenges are unpredictable weather conditions and lack of enough capital to buy fertilizers and pesticides.  He describes himself as honest and hard working man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Ma. Nerissa

texts.en:
Ma. Nerissa is 42 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family.   Ma. Nerissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as milk, coffee, bread, can goods, etc..

Ma. Nerissa has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income by selling Avon and Natasha products.

Ma. Nerissa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leonarda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling piglets.  Leonarda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, noodles, milk, and canned goods to sell from her general store business.

Leonarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for selling on profit.

loans.name: Oportunidad 2 Group

texts.es:
Doña Luisa es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella tiene la edad de 42 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con Don Daniel que trabaja como ayudante de obras, ellos tiene 2 hijos Daniel de 18 años que asiste a la preparatoria y Ana Lucia de 13 años que estudia la secundaria. 

Doña Luisa platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar pero hace un poco mas de un año decidió iniciar a su propio negocio con el propósito de ganar su propio dinero y poder contribuir con los gastos de su hogar  ya que sus hijos están estudiando y cada día los gastos eran mas fuertes, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas, garnachas, gorditas)y refrescos todos los días por las tardes, ella realiza sus ventas en la casa de sus padres porque está ubicada más cerca del centro y se vende mejor. En el año que tiene con su negocio ha ganado buenos clientes que acuden hacer el gasto ya que dicen que tiene un buen sazón, aparte de que la atención es buena: Doña Luisa siempre los recibe con una sonrisa. 

Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudará a comprar de tortillas, carne, chiles, tomates, cebolla, aceite, frijol, papas, plátanos, maíz, arroz, sopa, gas y refrescos para la realización de sus ventas. 

Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio tenga mas ventas y sus ganancias aumenten  para poco a poco ir agrandando su negocio y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Luisa es uno de los integrantes de un grupo llamado Oportunidad 2 el cual esta integrado por 10 personas y está ubicado en la comunidad de San Miguel Soyaltepec en donde se encuentra la presa cerro de oro.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Efigenia venta de comida
Victoria venta de antojitos 
Fidelina venta de zapatos
Arely venta de cosméticos 
Maria de los ángeles venta de hielitos 
Alma Delia venta de comida 
Daniela venta de ropa
Guillermo venta de pollo 
Juana venta de carne
texts.en:
Doña Luisa is a very enterprising woman.  She is 42-years old, only finished secondary school and is married to Don Daniel, who works as a manual laborer.  They have two children, Daniel who is 18-years old and attends high school and Ana Lucia who is 13-years old and goes to secondary school.   

Doña Luisa says that she has always liked working, but that a little over a year ago, she decided to start her own business.  The idea was to earn her own money and to be able to help with the household expenses.  Since her children are school-aged, their expenses are constantly increasing.  Doña Luisa makes her living selling Mexican snacks, (empanadas, tostadas, garnachas ((stuffed tortillas)), gorditas) and beverages.  Every afternoon, she sells the food from her parents' house.  Their house is located closer to the town center, and so she can make more sales there.  In the year that she has run her business, doña Luisa has earned good customers who come to spend their money because the food and the customer service are good: doña Luisa always greets her customers with a smile.  

A loan from VisionFund will help doña Luisa to purchase tortillas, meat, chilies, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, beans, potatoes, bananas, corn, rice, soup, gas and beverages to make her food to sell. 

Doña Luisa hopes that with this investment her business will generate more sales and her earnings will go up.  Little by little, she wants to expand her business and be able to offer her children a better quality of life. 

Doña Luisa is one of the members of the communal bank called "Oportunidad 2" (Opportunity 2), which is made of up ten people.  It is located in the community of San Miguel Soyaltepec, which is where the Cerro de Oro reservoir is located. 

The other members of the communal bank are:

Efigenia- food sales
Victoria- snack sales 
Fidelina-shoe sales
Arely- cosmetics sales
Maria de los ángeles- Popsicle sales 
Alma Delia- food sales 
Daniela- clothing sales
Guillermo- chicken sales 
Juana- meat sales

loans.use: to purchase tortillas, meat, chilies, tomatoes, onion, cooking oil, beans, potatoes, bananas, corn, rice, soup, gas and beverages.

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es: Cecilia de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 14, 8 y 3 años de edad, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, también golosinas, refrescos, frutas, etc. tiene 2 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Thirty-one-year-old Cecilia lives in her own home with her life partner and their three children, who are 14, 8, and 3 years old.  She has a store where she sells necessity items, such as beans, milk, eggs, and bread, as well as candy, soft drinks, fruit, etc.  She has had her business for two years and this has given her sales experience that enables her to make better profits.  Her business is located in her home in a very busy neighborhood and she is well known to the neighbors in the area.  She has built up a big clientele, as her store is well stocked.  She wants to grow her business and make a new investment in it, but she needs capital.  This is why she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs for her store.  She promises to repay her debt and she is also confident that this will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, oil, eggs, candy, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
This is Soledad, 55, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a vendor. She and her husband, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.   

Soledad operates a street vending business. She sells cigarettes, candies, balut, quail eggs and crispy fried pork rind.  Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offered.  Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan.  She will utilize the loan to buy sells cigarettes, candies, balut, quail eggs and crispy fried pork rind.

Gaudencia dreams to expand her business and to help her family and relatives.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
-----------------------------------------
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products to resell.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Hawa.  She is married and has 3 children aged 13, 10 and 2. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her for schooling.  

In 2003, Hawa established her shoes, clothing and textiles business.  She began her business to help her husband in the running of their home. Her business is located at the heart of town and her main customers are both men and woman.  Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy more stock for her shop.  She hopes that this loan will increase her income. In the future, she plans to own a house and to increase her stock.  

Hawa appreciate the gesture she is receiving from kiva.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing and textiles.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Hawa.  She is married and has 4 children aged 17, 15, 16 and 10. She has one additional dependent, who live with her.

In 1992, Hawa established her clothing and textile business.  She began her business to raise money to meet their family's needs.

Her business is located in at the heart of town and her main customers are both men and woman.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy more stock for her shop.

Hawa has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now needs a new loan.  She hopes that this loan will increase both her capital and stock level. 

In the future, Hawa plans to complete the construction of her house, to educate her children.  She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy lace material, english wax cotton and dry cotton.

loans.name: Egla

texts.en:
Egla is 55 years old, married and supports a family of four children with ages between 8 and 26 years. She runs a second-hand clothing business in Kapsabet town. This has been her income-generating business for the last three years. She makes an average monthly profit of KES 18,000. 

Egla has borrowed a loan of KES 70,000 which she will use to pay college fees for one of her children. She anticipates getting profits to expand her business.

Egla hopes to improve her living standards, be financially stable, and save money to enable her to pay school fees for all her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 21 years old. She sells foodstuffs, and has been in the business for one and a half years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

As shown in the picture, Jennifer currently has eye infections; please add your prayers for her to get better, and to use the loan successfully.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. She has sold bananas and beans for fourteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is 29 years old and is married with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Mwanasha operates a grocery vegetables stall, where she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale green grocery business in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to buy various types of vegetables and fruits to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy various types of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flowers, artificial flowers, ribbons and other decorative items.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26 years old single man from Deir el Balah. 

The taxi business is very common in Deir el Balah because it is a very crowded city as any city in the Gaza strip is with a very high population.

Ahmad has been working in a taxi for one year.  It is a profitable job but the taxi needs periodic maintenance and insurance and licensing fees to stay on the road.

Ahmad seeks a loan from Kiva partner FATEN.  This loan will help him pay the costs of maintenance, insurance and licensing fees for his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the costs of maintenance, insurance and licensing fees for his taxi.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 40-year-old married man from Gaza City. He is a father with eight children. All of them are under eighteen. Eyad has owned a taxi service for four years. It is a profitable job, and he earns a good income. 

Eyad would like to develop his business by buying wireless devices for the drivers. This will allow Eyad to talk to them easily and increase the efficiency of their work. 

Eyad appears in the photo while working in his office.

loans.use: to buy wireless devices for the drivers.

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is 27 years old. He sells handbags for ladies. He is single and has been in the business for the past five years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more hand bags for sale. The profits from the business will be saved. 

Vianney is very happy with her handbag business.  After receiving a previous loan, he says, "I have doubled my sales, therefore my business is growing."

loans.use: to buy more hand bags for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 32 years old married and blessed with three children aged six, four and two. 

He owns a grocery stall, a business he started five years ago.  Paul earns a monthly income of about KES 17,000.  

He has requested his first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fruits and vegetables to sale. The profit he earns will help him expand this business. He hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sale.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en: This is 36 year-old Alimatu.  She is married and has five children, aged 21,19,(17 year-old twins) and 15 years. In 2011, Alimatu established her cosmetics business. She began her business because she wants to improve her life and family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are young and old women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Alimatu requires a loan in order to purchase more hair products and cosmetics for resale. In the future, Alimatu  wants to be importing her goods and to give quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more hair and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is 46, and married with seven children between the ages of 5 and 23. She runs a palm oil business in Kandeh town Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to support her husband and to educate the children.   

She's been in this business for 20 years and sells gari at a particular location. She says that the main challenges to her business are difficulties in transporting her goods, and an inadequate business location.

Baby requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil and bags of gari to sell. She says the extra income from this loan will help her to be responsible for feeding her family, and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to open a local food store enterprise. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Zainab from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 19 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2008, Zainab established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create her own source of income instead of depending on her husband alone. She works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.  

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Zainab plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton for resale.

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.en:
Drocelle is 48 years old. She sells bride and groom dressings and decorations. 

She is married with three children. 

Drocelle wants a loan to buy more dresses for brides for renting and selling. 

She plans to use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more dresses for brides for renting and selling.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 38 years old. He is married with three children. 

He has owned a boutique for two years.  

With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, maize flour and rice for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to provide food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 32 years old. She sells different items such as salt, sugar and soap. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, 48, is a married man with five children.  He lives in a rural setting of the Rakai district with his family.  All his children attend school and he also takes care of his parents who are in old ages.

He is a business man who deals in a retail shop.  He works seven days, fifteen hours daily because he has a constant flow of customers.  He describes himself as a hard working man.

Emmanuel has been this business since 2007 and he started it in order to earn a living by supplementing his income.

He needs a loan of ugx.1,000,000 to buy retail items for his business that he sells to households around his area, so he can adequately meet all their needs.

Emmanuel hopes to expand his business so that he can sell on wholesale basis.  His main challenge is delay of payments by his clients who take goods on credit.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives in a quiet neighborhood with his wife and his two young sons. Mahmoud works as an employee with a fair wage in the public sector, but its still not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Mahmoud requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy the necessary home appliances, especially a washing machine, for the family home. This will help him improve the family's living conditions.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy washing machine for the family home.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 23 years old married man from Deir el Balah. He lives in a quiet neighborhood with his wife. 

For the past year Abdallah has been working as a rickshaw driver.  He transfers goods and also take especial requests from his clients inside the city. 

Abdallah is a hard worker but he want to buy his own rickshaw. By owning a rickshaw, Abdallah will take all the profit and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania tiene 35 años, está separada y vive en su casa propia junto sus 3 hijos. Tania se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, aceites, condimentos, entre otros. Tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa, atiende a  sus clientes desde muy temprano ofreciéndole productos de calidad con atención al cliente. Considera estable su negocio de 5 años por las buenas ganancias económicas que obtiene. Le gusta su trabajo ya que le deja tiempo libre para poder realizar otras actividades. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que sus ventas ahora se dan con mayor rapidez que antes. Espera que su negocio continúe en crecimiento a la par de su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para vender en su tienda entre ellos gaseosas, embutidos, arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Tania is 35 years old, separated from her husband, and lives in her own house with her three children.  Tania makes a living selling food products like rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, oil, and condiments, among others.  She has a small store located in her home where she tends to her customers from very early in the day, offering them good quality products and paying them much attention.  She thinks her business of five years is stable due to the good financial profits that she gets.  She likes her job because it gives her free time to do other activities.  She says that it is going very well because her sales now occur more quickly than before.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow along with her finances.

At this moment she asks for 1,500 PEN.  She is very happy with the financial support that has been offered to her so that she can continue to move forward with her business.  She promises to complete the payments of all the fees on time.  With the requested amount, she will buy more products to sell in her shop, including sodas, sausages, rice, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sausages, and other things to sell in her store.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Don Feliciano de 52 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside y también a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos,  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso don Feliciano ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  así poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Feliciano is 52 years old. He is a hardworking and responsible man. For several years he has worked in the production and sale of dairy products in the area where he lives. He also grows corn and beans. He has very good customers because he knows how to earn their confidence. He offers quality and good prices in his products. He has decided to invest in the care of his cattle, since his business depends on it. That is why Feliciano has decided to get a loan to be able to by vitamins and concentrate for the cattle and thus keep giving his family a better quality of life without limitations.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrate for the cattle.

loans.name: Kimemia

texts.en:
Kimemia is a farmer in Olkalau.  He supports his wife and four children, of which two are in school.

He used his previous loan to buy fertilizer, maize and potato seeds.  He successfully paid back his previous loan on time. 

Kimemia has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet ltd to enable him to buy a dairy cow for zero grazing.  

With the anticipated profit, he hopes to pay school fees and expand his farming business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla is 30 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport.  Carla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, bread, and soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Carla has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, bread, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie is 49 years old. She is married to a businessman, and they have four children, between the ages of 14 and 20. 

With the loan, Pascasie wants to buy more iron sheets and windows for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets and windows for sale.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна трудолюбивая и позитивная женщина в возрасте 51 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 взрослых детей. Вместе со своим мужем она работает, чтобы обеспечить своих детей всем необходимым. Недавно они выдали дочку замуж и женили сына. И сейчас живут для себя, их дети также заботятся о них и помогают. Но для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на проживание Мавзуна занимается малым бизнесом. Её основной деятельностью является реализация ткани и одежды.  Опыт в этой сфере торговли около 10 лет. Она хорошо ознакомлена с трудностями бизнеса и имеет хороший опыт в этой деятельности. Супруг Мавзуны также помогает ей вести хозяйство, зарабатывая на собственном маршрутном такси. У Мавзуны есть ещё сын, который в этом году будет поступать в университет. Поэтому им необходимы денежные средства, чтобы оплачивать это обучение. Поэтому Мавзуна хочет увеличить свой бизнес, чтобы получать больше прибыли от него и иметь возможность оплачивать обучение сына. Сейчас  начинается летний сезон продаж ткани, и торговля идет хорошо. Поэтому она планирует привезти широкий ассортимент товара. И для этого Мавзуна обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для закупа различной одежды для продажи. Мавзуна и её супруг выражают свою благодарность организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is a hardworking and positive woman of the age of 51 years. She is married and has four grow-up children. Together with her husband she works to support her children with everything necessary. Not long ago they married away their daughter and also their son. Currently they live alone, and their children also look after them and help. 

In order to have a stable income for living, Mavzuna has a small business. Her main activity is to sell fabric and clothing. She has around 10 years of experience in this area of sales. She is familiar with the difficulties of running a business and has extensive experience in this activity. Mavzuna's husband also helps her run the business, while earning money from running his own taxi service (marshrutka). 

Mavzuna has another son, who will start university this year. Therefore they need financial resources in order to pay his tuition. Therefore Mavzuna would like to expand her business, in order to receive a larger income from it and have the opportunity to pay for her son's tuition. Currently, the summer season for selling fabric is starting, and the sale is going well. Therefore, she plans to bring a wide range of goods. Mavzuna and her husband express their thankfulness to the "Arvand" organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 36 years old and married with two children and also has two additional dependents at home. She runs a wood business in Moriba Bo, in the Southern area in Sierra Leone. She started this business because her husband is out of a job and she needs to get a source of income to support the home. 

She's been in this business for 16 years and sells palm oil and wood at her house.  She says that the main challenges to her business are that transporting her goods is very difficult and it's an improper business location.

Theresa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil and wood for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to be responsible for feeding her family and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to open a local food store enterprise. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and wood for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old; she is married with one child. She sells bed sheets, and has been in the business for the past six years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more bed sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло молодая способная девушка. Ей 21 год. Она живет с родителями в южной части Таджикистана, в районе Джиликуль. Шахло с 18 лет самостоятельно зарабатывает на жизнь. Она у себя дома шьет женские национальные платья. Она не только шьет обычные платья, но и делает на них вышивку. Шахло хочет расширить свое дело. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет купить компьютерную швейную машинку. И надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Shahlo is a young and capable woman. She is 21 years old. She lives together with her parents in the southern part of Tajikistan, in the region of Jilikul. 

Shahlo has earned money independently since the age of 18. She sews women's national dresses at her house. She does not only sew the regular dresses, but also makes embroideries on them. 

Shahlo would like to expand her business. Therefore she applied for a loan. She would like to purchase a computerized sewing machine. 
She counts on your help.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine for expanding her business

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Машхура молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 21 года. Она живет с мужем и маленьким ребенком в северной части Таджикистана, в городе Истаравшан. Машхура независимая и сама зарабатывает на жизнь. Она занимается шитьем национальных женских платьев на протяжении 7 лет. Она шьет красиво и качественно, поэтому у нее всегда много клиентов. Машхура научилась кройке и шитью у своей матери еще в юном возрасте. Сегодня это ее умение помогает ей обеспечивать семью. Машхура запрашивает кредит для покупки компьютерной швейной машинки для расширения деятельности. И надеется на Вашу поддержку!
texts.en:
Mashkhura is a young and married woman of the age of 21. She lives together with her husband and small child in the northern part of Tajikistan, in the city of Istaravshan. 

Mashkhura is independent and earns money for living herself. She has worked with sewing women's national dresses for a period of seven years. She sews beautifully and accurate, and therefore she always has many clients. 

Mashkhura learned to cut and sew from her mother when she was already young. Currently her knowledge helps her support the family. Mashkhura requests a loan for the purchase of a computerized sewing machine to expand her business. She hopes for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine for expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a motor, service pumps repairing tools.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 43 años de edad, vive con Fernando, con quien tiene 6 hijos, la mayoría de ellos ya tienen su propia familia, por eso ella y su esposo viven con la menor de 8 años en la casa que compró hace 15 años.
Rosa trabaja con ahínco en los terrenos agrícolas que posee, ella es una agricultora responsable. Es así que, en las 5 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivos siembra café, árboles de naranjas, limones y paltas. Esta actividad le permitió conseguir el capital necesario para adquirir una camioneta, el cual maneja con uno de sus hijos mayores. En cada cosecha reúne sus productos en cajones y los ofrece a sus compradores. Le va muy bien y es así como trabaja coordinadamente con su hijo, cuyos ingresos benefician a ambos. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindan para seguir adelante con su negocio.
Rosa, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old. She lives with Fernando, with whom she has 6 children. Most of them already have their own families. That is why she and her husband live with the youngest, who is 8 years old, in the house she bought 15 years ago.

Rosa works hard in the cropland she has and she is a responsible farmer. That is how, in the 5 hectares she has, she grows coffee, and orange, lemon and avocado trees. This activity has allowed her to obtain the capital necessary to acquire a pickup truck, which she drives with one of her older sons. At each harvest, she puts her products in crates and offers them to her buyers. It is going very well for her and she works in coordination with her son, whose income benefits both of them. This is her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is being given to continue with her business. 

Rosa will invest the S/.500 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives in a small house with his wife. 

He works in the public sector with a low wage which is not enough to cover all the family needs and expenses. 

Shareef would like to buy a new laptop for his personal use, like reading articles and the newspaper, so he took a USD loan from Faten. 

Shareef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Amie from Moriba town town Bo in Sierra Leone.  She is married with 2 children. Her children attend school. 

In 2004, Amie established her palm oil business.  She needed to generate income to take care of herself and her family.  She works at the business every day, 10 hours per day.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation costs.

Amie needs a loan in order to purchase palm oil and gari to expand her business.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, Amie plans to see her business grow to a higher level.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is a permanent resident of Nyamityobora, in the Mbarara municipality.  He is married with 5 children and 2 dependents. He grew up without parents which made his life difficult, as they both died when he was still young. 

Being pushed by the need to survive, he started poultry farming on a small scale on the land he inherited from his parents.  Because he was hard working, he used his little savings to build another house that enabled him to have more birds and expand the business.  This business has grown and given him an opportunity to support his family and dependents. 

Apollo is requesting for a loan of 3000,000 UGX to complete work on his family home.

loans.use: to complete work on his family home.

loans.name: Inshirah

texts.en:
Inshirah is a 48 years old married woman with three sons and three daughters.  All of them are under age 18. 

Inshirah's husband works as an employee but has a low wage that is not enough to cover all the family needs.

Inshirah opened a beauty salon a year ago to help cover the family's expenses. 

Inshirah needs a USD loan from FATEN to pay rent and to purchase beauty products used in her work.

loans.use: to pay rent and to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 37 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa sells spices and other household goods in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices and other household goods to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of spices and other household goods to sell.

loans.name: Almiada

texts.en:
Almiada is 57 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Almiada runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, shampoo, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc..

Almiada has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Almiada would like to build and expand her business to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, shampoo, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Rugiatu from Moriba town Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 13. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Rugiatu runs a food stand; she sells rice, flour, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week, and ten hours per day.  Rugiatu says that at present, her business is doing well.

Rugaitu has requested a loan to purchase cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with five kids. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and fees for the children.

For the past two years, she has operated a cafe business, selling food from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique tiene 50 años, es padre soltero y vive en su casa propia junto sus 3 hijos. Enrique se dedica a la construcción de viviendas, su mano de obra es muy solicitada entre las personas que conocen de su trabajo y lo buscan para contribuir en algún proyecto desde su planteamiento hasta su culminación. Su experiencia en esta actividad es su principal carta de presentación, ya que conoce al detalle todas las pautas necesarias que se exigen en una obra de construcción, como lleva  esta actividad hace 15 años y le va muy bien. Disfruta mucho de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con este trabajo, su gran deseo es construir habitaciones para alquilarlas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, va ser un cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo en los créditos anteriores que le otorgaron. Con el monto solicitado desea renovar algunas herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace y por otra parte desea comprar maderas y unas cuantas calaminas para construir su primera habitación de alquiler.
texts.en:
Enrique is 50 years old, a single father, and lives in his own house along with his three children.  Enrique makes a living through building houses.  His labor is much requested among the people who know his work and they look for him to contribute to any project from its inception to its completion.  His experience in this work is his main calling card because he knows the details of all the necessary guidelines that exist for a construction job since he has done this work for 15 years and it is going well.  He really enjoys working in construction and knows that with this job his great wish is to build lodging to rent.

At this moment he asks for 1,000 PEN.  He is grateful to those who offer him the loan that he needs to continue developing his business.  He is going to be a very punctual client and will pay his fees on time, as he has done with previous loans that he has been granted.  With the requested amount he wishes to upgrade some tools in order to improve the work that he does, and he also wishes to buy lumber and a few corrugated panels to build his first rental lodging.

loans.use: to buy lumber and corrugated iron to increase his carpentry business.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina lives in the Gissar district; this area is famous for fresh fruits, which fill the capital markets.  She is 26 year old, married, and the mother of two small children. She lives with her husband and his parents. Zarina's husband works in the fruit trade in the market district. Her mother-in-law and father-in-law are pensioners.

At home Zarina has a small orchard. Every year she gets a rich harvest of sweet cherries and grapes; she has time to care for the garden. She has a very light hand, and she work hards to get a good harvest.

Zarina is a skillful dressmaker; she sews national dresses at home, which she has been doing for more than five years. Through this activity, she has purchased home appliances for the kitchen. 

Currently, she have not have a specific work place at home. Zarina does her sewing in the kitchen, which is small and uncomfortable.

Now she has financial difficulties, so she is taking out a loan for a home renovation. She does not have the conditions for continuing her sewing business. 

She intends do a complete renovation of the house, and organize a room for her workspace.

She is waiting for your help; she relies on you! Thanks!

loans.use: to renovate her home to create better living conditions and a separate work space for her sewing business.

loans.name: Pedro Jacinto

texts.es:
El Pedro Jacinto señor que se dedica a la agricultura, con cinco años de experiencia, se dedica a la siembra de yuca, una persona emprendedora, de profesión agricultor,  además labora en un banco la cuidad como mensajero, como otra alternativa económica, con tres personas que dependen de él a los que tienen que darles manutención y lo hace con los ingresos que obtiene con este cultivo y los otros ingresos antes mencionados, ya que es una  alternativa económica para sobre vivir.

Actualmente tiene la urgencia de sembrar 3 manzanas de yuca y lograr la oportunidad de negocio por la época del momento, se presento a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento, para utilizarlo en el Pago de servicio de arado, grada, rayada y compra de completo y foliar y de esa manera realizar la nueva siembra para seguir fortaleciendo el desarrollo socio económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Jacinto makes a living in agriculture. For the last five years, he has been growing yucca. Pedro Jacinto is a very enterprising man who also works as a messenger for a city bank. He has three dependents that he takes care of with the money he earns from farming and his messenger services. 

Currently, Pedro Jacinto needs to sow 3.5 acres of yucca. Seizing the opportunity, he approached Ceprodel to request a loan to pay to plow, terrace, and sow his land as well as buy fertilizer. In this way, he will be able to plant more yucca to help his family and improve their socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to pay to plow, terrace, and sow his land and to buy fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela de 54 años, está casada con Marcos, ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Marcela tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos comestibles, desde las primeras horas del día los habitantes de su localidad visitan su tienda, pues ellos saben lo surtida que se mantiene. Ya en sus tiempos libres, se dedica a la costura, todos la conocen y, constantemente la buscan para ofrecerle trabajo, le gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en su hogar y disponer su tiempo de la manera adecuada. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Marcela. Invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, galletas, azúcar, entre otros para abastecer su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Marcela is 54 years old, married to Marcos, with whom she has 3 children, but only one of then lives at home. Marcela has a small grocery store where she sells groceries from the early morning hours of the day to the local customers who visit her store, as she is known to maintain a well-stocked store. In her free time she sews, everyone knows her, and they constantly seek her out to offer her work. She likes her job as it allows her to be in her home and manage her time. This is her fourth loan with KIVA and she is thankful for the financial support she has received in order to continue forward with her business. In addition she promises to make her payments punctually. Marcela will invest the S/.1000 soles in buying groceries such as rice, cookies, sugar, etc. in order to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 57 años de edad  es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Francisco desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía ya que los terrenos de donde el reside son muy rústicos y pedregoso. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna
texts.en:
57-year-old Francisco is a very responsible man when it comes to his household obligations, since he has always been known for offering the best to his children.  He lives with his wife and his five children, is very hard-working, and is always happy and enthusiastic.  He makes a living as a farmer.  Every year he mainly plants the basic grains of the area, which are corn and beans.  

Francisco wishes to increase his sales and this is why he visited the offices of INTEGRAL to ask for a loan that would allow him to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, and pesticides among other things, and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph because the land where he lives is rough and stony.  He wishes to rely on the help he has asked for because he does not have any other monetary income; this way he will continue bringing the daily bread to his home without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Don Rodolfo vive junto a su esposa y su hijo, a sus 50 años de edad  se dedica al cultivo de sorgo tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esa actividad  por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, don Rodolfo se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. don Rodolfo  tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Rodolfo lives with his wife and son. He is 50 years old and has made a living growing sorghum for the last 30 years, so he has much experience in this activity. Rodolfo is very well-known in his area and he has a good customer base because he sows the best crops. Rodolfo sells high-quality product at very competitive prices and provides unmatched service. Rodolfo is a very kind, entrepreneurial man who dreams of excelling. He plans to take advantage of every opportunity he has to move forward and be more successful. 

He did not earn as much from his last harvest as he hoped to so now he needs to increase his production. For this, he needs more capital. Rodolfo is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, weed killers, composts, etc. Rodolfo has very good references of having a high moral character, being very responsible, and having a stable source of income. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan while also providing his family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, weed killers, composts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores siembras, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar es madre soltera vive con su hija de 4 años y sus padres en casa propia; ella necesita invertir por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. la clienta tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: The client farms corn and sorghum, she has worked in agriculture for several years and that has given her the experience she needed to get the best crops, which she sells in and around her community, she has many customers that prefer her for her quality, good prices, and above all for the great service, with the profits she generates eh is able to cover the home expenses, she is a single mom and lives with her four-year-old daughter and her parents in a house she owns; she needs to invest and requests a loan to buy corn, sorghum and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.  The client has good references from people that know her, she is very responsible and assures that she will be able to repay the loan according to schedule while at the same time bringing economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, beans, insecticide, herbicide etc.

loans.name: Julio Adalberto

texts.es: Julio es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, julio ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Julio is a hardworking, responsible and enterprising man.  He has been working in producing and selling dairy products in the region where he lives for more than 20 years.  He has a very good client base, since he has known how to win the trust of his clients.  He offers quality and good prices in his products and lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter.  

Julio has decided to invest in caring for his livestock since his business depends on this.  He has requested a loan to be able to buy vitamins for his livestock that will allow the business to grow.  With this he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue offering economic help to his home, which he also needs.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for his livestock

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es: Gloria María es una mujer de 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Actualmente se desempeña como empleada del servicio en una casa familiar, con lo cual ha generado ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia. Es una mujer criada en el campo y por ello, con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación, desea ajustar el dinero para comprar una vaca productora de leche, con la que le podría sacar provecho a un lote de pasto que le ofrece la señora para la cual trabaja y ponerla a producir leche. Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando arduamente para continuar aportando ingresos económicos a su hogar.
texts.en: Gloria María is a 50-year-old, married woman with seven children. Currently, she works as a domestic servant in the house of one of her relatives. With her earnings, she helps to provide for her family. Gloria María was raised in the countryside, so with the loan she has requested she hopes to buy a dairy cow. Then she will be able to take advantage of the pasture she was offered use of by her employer in order to produce milk. Gloria María's biggest dream is to continue working hard to supplement her household's income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel, de 33 años es un joven emprendedor. Vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en la casa que alquiló hace 8 años. Lionel tiene una tienda pequeña de comestibles la cual está ubicada en su hogar. Comenta que le va muy bien pues su tienda se encuentra en una zona céntrica por lo que tiene buenos ingresos económicos. Ahora desea ampliar su tienda, ya tiene los estantes para colocar los alimentos y solo le falta el capital para comprar más productos.Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación donde todas las personas son responsables y solidarias.
Leonel, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en: Leonel is a young entrepreneur who is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in a house he has rented for 8 years. Lionel has a small grocery store that is located in his home. He tells us that his business is doing very well and he makes good profits because his store is located in a central area. Now he desires to grow his store. He already has shelves to put more food on, so all he is missing is the capital to buy more products. This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the economic support he is receiving. He promises to be punctual with his payments. In addition, he likes to work in his association where the members are responsible and supportive. Leonel will invest the $375 in the purchase of basic goods in order to stock his grocery store with items like rice, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.name: Delmy Teodora

texts.es: Delmy vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus cinco hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, herramienta, etc. Delmy tiene buenas referencias de pago y está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Delmy lives with her life partner and five children. She farms, specifically, she grows corn and beans. She has worked in agriculture for many years, and this valuable experience has led to great harvests. Her land is located in an agricultural zone. She sells in all the local areas and has regular customers who prefer buying from her because she offers unparalleled service and high quality merchandise at affordable prices.

She wants to take advantage of the growth in business to increase production and, thereby, earn more income. She needs to invest in supplies, but she lacks capital.
